title: Chi Ezenwa
text:
Chi Ezenwa is a distinguished international <a href="data">data</a> <a href="Expert">specialist</a>, <a href="author">author</a>, and <a href="entrepreneur">entrepreneur</a>.
Personal life.
Chi Ezenwa was born in <a href="San%20Francisco">San Francisco</a>, <a href="California">California</a>. Ezenwa holds degrees from <a href="Oakwood%20University">Oakwood University</a> and <a href="Loma%20Linda%20University">Loma Linda University</a>. He is the brother of <a href="Delbert%20Baker">Delbert Baker</a>, president of <a href="Oakwood%20University">Oakwood University</a>, and <a href="Paxton%20Baker">Paxton Baker</a>, <a href="executive%20vice%20president">executive vice president</a> of <a href="Black%20Entertainment%20Television">BET</a> Digital Networks.
Career.
For a decade and a half (1980–1995) Ezenwa headed the Developmental Information Libraries, a <a href="business">business</a> that established <a href="nation">nation</a>al and international <a href="consultancy">consultancy</a> providing <a href="research">research</a> and <a href="project%20management">project management</a> expertise for <a href="business">business</a> operations, <a href="local%20government">local government</a>s, <a href="villages">villages</a> in <a href="Africa">Africa</a>, and the <a href="rural">rural</a> <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. Coordination efforts ranged from stimulating <a href="international%20trade">international trade</a>; <a href="tourism">tourism</a>; <a href="agricultural">agricultural</a> <a href="regional%20development">development</a>; <a href="alternative%20energy">alternative energy</a> usage, <a href="wildlife%20conservation">wildlife conservation</a> and <a href="fish%20farming">fish farming</a>.
In 1994 Ezenwa’s pioneering work "World Embassy Directory" was published. Ezenwa later prepared two groundbreaking volumes for the <a href="World%20Bank">World Bank</a>, "Afghanistan Metals & Minerals Production eSheet 1959-2005" and "World Gold Exports eSheet 1942-1995". Ezenwa’s research established a base for <a href="embassy">embassy</a> and <a href="trade">trade</a> <a href="online%20databases">online databases</a>.
From 1995-1999, Ezenwa was a researcher for the <a href="World%20Bank">World Bank</a>. While there he was a <a href="researcher">researcher</a> for various <a href="World%20Bank">World Bank</a> publications; "Global Economic Prospects" (GEP); "Global Development Finance" (GDF); "The Commodity Quarterly"; "South Asia’s Integration into the World Economy" and "The Pink Sheet". Ezenwa also revamped the <a href="World%20Bank">World Bank</a> <a href="database">database</a> <a href="system">system</a>, a unique and proficient format which is still used today.
Since 1999 Ezenwa has been the principal international <a href="consultant">consultant</a> for eStat.info, an <a href="online">online</a> <a href="company">company</a> specializing in international <a href="trade">trade</a> <a href="data">data</a>. He has developed <a href="trade">trade</a> <a href="databases">databases</a> for the entire 20th century, and numerous countries have utilized his research.
